intro: Amphimas pterocarpoides, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
